intro: Neosasamorpha shimidzuana subsp. kashidensis, commonly known as the Kashidense Neosasamorpha, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Japan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with five petals and a distinctive, fragrant aroma. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
